text: Francisco Valinés Cofresí (1878-1949) was an architect in Puerto Rico. He was born in Cabo Rojo in 1878. He studied architecture by correspondence, with the International Correspondence School of Chicago, Illinois, completing his studies in 1912. At least two of his works are listed for their architecture on the U.S. National Register of Historic Places (NRHP). ==Works== *his first major work was the Executive Mansion for the governor (la Mansión Ejecutiva of the Gobernador) of the U.S. Virgin Islands, in Saint John *the residence of José Calderón in Canóvanas *the residence of Angel Suárez in Guaynabo *La Giralda, 651 Jose Marti St., Santurce, San Juan, Puerto Rico, NRHP-listed *Palmira Lopez de Pereyo House, jct. of Font Martelo and Minerva Sts. Humacao, Puerto Rico, NRHP-listed *Original landscaping for the Luis Muñoz Rivera Park in San Juan, PR ==References== Category:1878 births Category:1949 deaths Category:Puerto Rican architects Category:People from Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico
title: Francisco Valinés Cofresí
